intro: Schoenodum, commonly known as the common grass, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Poaceae. It is characterized by its tall, slender stems and narrow leaves, typical of grasses. The flowers are usually small and clustered in spikelets, which are the basic units of grass inflorescences. Schoenodum species are often found in temperate regions and can thrive in a variety of soil types. These plants play an important role in ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various insects and small animals.
